conclusion: Determine how objects A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves forward, above the objects.
The light source is positioned above the objects, casting shadows on the ground.
The light source is moving forward, above the objects.
The shadows cast by objects A, B, C, and D are visible on the ground.
The shadows of objects A and B are elongated and appear to be moving forward.
The shadow of object C is more elongated and appears to be moving forward.
The shadow of object D is more elongated and appears to be moving forward.

Object B is located in the middle of the image.
Object C is located on the right side of the image.
Object D is located on the right side of the image.
The shadows of objects A and B are moving forward.
The shadow of object C is moving forward.

The shadows of objects A, B, C, and D are moving forward when the light source moves forward, above the objects.
